intro: Tococa macrosperma, commonly known as the Amazonian coffee plant, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other economically important plants like coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and produces small, white flowers that give way to bright red berries. Its fruit contains seeds that are used to make a traditional caffeine-rich beverage. Due to its ecological significance and potential commercial value, Tococa macrosperma is of interest for conservation and sustainable agriculture.
